How do I use a centralized intermediary to execute transactions on the Verus ID and NFT Marketplace?

You don't need to use a centralized intermediary to execute transactions on the Verus ID and NFT Marketplace. In fact, the marketplace allows for completely decentralized transactions, where you can execute transactions directly, peer-to-peer, without any intermediary necessary. You can pay or offer to pay from a transparent or zero-knowledge private address, and accept payment to either as well.

### Verus ID and NFT Marketplace
Buy and sell VerusIDs on-chain, advertising your offer directly to the owner of an ID or NFT, or posting the sale of your NFT on the worldwide blockchain for all the world to see. Execute transactions in a completely decentralized way. Pay or offer to pay from a transparent or zero-knowledge private address, still auditable by you. Accept payment to either as well, and best of all, execute your transactions directly, peer-to-peer without any intermediary necessary. Don’t worry the on-chain model still makes room for owners to select and share proceeds with value added agents, marketing organizations, or other participants in a new economy of provable digital ownership. It’s the next step in the evolution of VerusID, the most powerful self-sovereign identity and secure storage model for funds in the digital world.### Verus Vault
With Verus Vault you can now protect funds on a VerusID, even from theft of a private key! If you lock your VerusID with Vault you cannot spend funds from that identity at all until it is again unlocked. While locked, you can still stake those same funds on the Verus network and earn by doing so. Of course, you can also still receive funds.IT IS IMPORTANT TO NOTE THAT ENABLING REVOCATION, RECOVERY, AND ALL VERUS VAULT CAPABILITIES REQUIRE YOU TO HAVE ONE PRIMARY IDENTITY, AND AT LEAST ONE REVOCATION/RECOVERY ID CONFIGURED.
Can I spend funds from a VerusID that is locked with Verus Vault?

No, you cannot spend funds from a VerusID that is locked with Verus Vault. When you lock your VerusID with Vault, you cannot spend funds from that identity at all until it is again unlocked. However, you can still stake those same funds on the Verus network and earn by doing so, and you can also still receive funds.

### Verus ID and NFT Marketplace

Execute transactions in a completely decentralized way. Pay or offer to pay from a transparent or zero-knowledge private address, still auditable by you. Do I need to have multiple identities configured to use Verus Vault capabilities?

No, you don't need to have multiple identities configured to use Verus Vault capabilities. To use Verus Vault, you need to have one primary identity, and at least one revocation/recovery ID configured. This is a requirement to enable revocation, recovery, and all Verus Vault capabilities.
